00001 /**********************************************************doxygen*//** @file
00002  *  @brief   Bottleneck assignment problem (BAP) implemenation.
00003  *
00004  *  Implemenation of the bottleneck assignment problem (BAP) that's used as a 
00005  *  lower bound for the Bottleneck TSP objective value.
00006  *
00007  *  @author  John LaRusic
00008  *  @ingroup lib
00009  ****************************************************************************/
00010 #include "common.h"
00011 #include "lb.h"

00014  * Private function prototypes
00015  ****************************************************************************/
00016 /*
00017  *  @brief  Initialize flow data structures.
00018  *  @param  problem [in] problem data
00019  *  @param  min_cost [in] minimum cost to consider in problem
00020  *  @param  max_cost [in] maximum cost to consider in problem
00021  *  @param  s [in] source node index
00022  *  @param  t [in] sink node index
00023  *  @param  res [out] residual graph to construct
00024  *  @param  m [out] number of edges
00025  *  @param  dist [out] distance labels
00026  *  @param  pred [out] predecessor labels
00027  */
00028 void
00029 initialize_flow_data(arrow_problem *problem, int min_cost, int max_cost,
00030                      int s, int t, int **res, int *m, int *dist, int *pred);
00031 
00032 /*
00033  *  @brief  Shortest augmenting path algorithm for max-flow.
00034  *  @param  n [in] size of the graph
00035  *  @param  s [in] source node index
00036  *  @param  t [in] sink node index
00037  *  @param  stop [in] stop when d[s] >= stop
00038  *  @param  res [out] the residual graph -- res[i][j] > 0 indicates the edge
00039  *              (i,j) exists in the residual graph; res[i][j] < 0 indicates
00040  *              flow is going through (i, j)
00041  *  @param  dist [out] indicates distance labels for each node
00042  *  @param  pred [out] indicates predecessors for each node
00043  *  @param  flow [out] holds the flow found from s to t
00044  */
00045 void
00046 shortest_augmenting_path(int n, int s, int t, int stop, 
00047                          int **res, int *dist, int *pred, int *flow);
00048 
00049 /*
00050  *  @brief  Ford-Fulkerson labeling algorithm for max-flow.
00051  *  @param  n [in] size of the graph
00052  *  @param  s [in] source node index
00053  *  @param  t [in] sink node index
00054  *  @param  res [out] the residual graph -- res[i][j] > 0 indicates the edge
00055  *              (i,j) exists in the residual graph; res[i][j] < 0 indicates
00056  *              flow is going through (i, j)
00057  *  @param  label [out] labels for each node
00058  *  @param  pred [out] indicates predecessors for each node
00059  *  @param  flow [out] holds the flow found from s to t
00060  *  @param  list [out] temporary list
00061  */                      
00062 void
00063 ford_fulkerson_labeling(int n, int s, int t, int **res, int *label,
00064                         int *pred, int *flow,  int *list);

00066 /****************************************************************************
00067  * Public function implementations
00068  ****************************************************************************/
00069 int
00070 arrow_bap_solve(arrow_problem *problem, arrow_problem_info *info, 
00071                 arrow_bound_result *result)
00072 {
00073     int ret = ARROW_SUCCESS;
00074     int m, stop;
00075     int low, high, median, delta, flow;
00076     int found_assignment;
00077     double start_time, end_time;
00078     
00079     int n = problem->size * 2 + 2;
00080     int s = n - 2;
00081     int t = n - 1;
00082     
00083     int **res;
00084     int *res_space;
00085     int *dist;
00086     int *pred;
00087     int *list;
00088     
00089     start_time = arrow_util_zeit();
00090     found_assignment = ARROW_FALSE;
00091     
00092     /* Dynamic memory allocation GO! */
00093     if(!arrow_util_create_int_matrix(n, n, &res, &res_space))
00094     {
00095         ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00096         goto CLEANUP;
00097     }
00098     if(!arrow_util_create_int_array(n, &dist))
00099     {
00100         ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00101         goto CLEANUP;
00102     }
00103     if(!arrow_util_create_int_array(n, &pred))
00104     {
00105         ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00106         goto CLEANUP;
00107     }
00108     if(!arrow_util_create_int_array(n, &list))
00109     {
00110         ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00111         goto CLEANUP;
00112     }
00113     
00114     /*arrow_debug("Number of Unique Costs: %d\n", info->cost_list_length);*/
00115 
00116     low = 0;
00117     high = info->cost_list_length - 1;
00118     while(low != high)
00119     {
00120         median = ((high - low) / 2) + low;
00121         delta = info->cost_list[median];  
00122         /*
00123         arrow_debug("Low[%d] = %d, High[%d] = %d\n", low, info->cost_list[low], high, info->cost_list[high]);
00124         arrow_debug("Checking if assignment possible for C[i,j] <= %d\n", delta);
00125         */  
00126         flow = 0;
00127         
00128         initialize_flow_data(problem, INT_MIN, delta, s, t, res, &m, dist, pred);
00129 
00130         stop = (int)(2 * pow(n, 2.0 / 3.0) + 0.5);
00131         m = (int)(sqrt(m * 1.0) + 0.5);
00132         /*arrow_debug("n^2/3 = %d; m^1/2 = %d\n", stop, m);*/
00133         if(m < stop) stop = m;
00134         
00135         shortest_augmenting_path(n, s, t, stop, res, dist, pred, &flow);
00136         /*arrow_debug("Flow after shortest augmenting path routine: %d\n", flow);*/
00137         if(flow < problem->size)
00138         {
00139             ford_fulkerson_labeling(n, s, t, res, dist, pred, &flow, list);
00140             /*arrow_debug("Flow after Ford Fulkerson labelling: %d\n", flow);*/
00141         }
00142         /*
00143         else
00144             arrow_debug("No need to call Ford Fulkerson labelling.\n");
00145         arrow_debug("\n");
00146         */
00147         
00148         if(flow == problem->size)
00149         {
00150             found_assignment = ARROW_TRUE;
00151             high = median;
00152         }
00153         else
00154         {
00155             low = median + 1;
00156         }
00157     }
00158     end_time = arrow_util_zeit();
00159     
00160     /* Return the cost we converged to as the answer */
00161     if(!found_assignment)
00162         result->obj_value = -1;
00163     else
00164         result->obj_value = info->cost_list[low];
00165     result->total_time = end_time - start_time;
00166     
00167 CLEANUP:
00168     if(dist != NULL) free(dist);
00169     if(pred != NULL) free(pred);
00170     if(res_space != NULL) free(res_space);
00171     if(res != NULL) free(res);
00172     if(list != NULL) free(list);
00173     
00174     return ret;
00175 }
00176 
00177 int
00178 arrow_bap_has_assignment(arrow_problem *problem, int min_cost, int max_cost, 
00179                          int *result)
00180 {
00181     int ret = ARROW_SUCCESS;
00182     int m, stop;
00183     
00184     int n = problem->size * 2 + 2;
00185     int s = n - 2;
00186     int t = n - 1;
00187     
00188     int **res;
00189     int *res_space;
00190     int *dist;
00191     int *pred;
00192     int *list;
00193     
00194     int flow = 0;
00195     *result = ARROW_FALSE;
00196     
00197     /* Dynamic memory allocation GO! */
00198     if(!arrow_util_create_int_matrix(n, n, &res, &res_space))
00199     {
00200         ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00201         goto CLEANUP;
00202     }
00203     if(!arrow_util_create_int_array(n, &dist))
00204     {
00205         ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00206         goto CLEANUP;
00207     }
00208     if(!arrow_util_create_int_array(n, &pred))
00209     {
00210         ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00211         goto CLEANUP;
00212     }
00213     if(!arrow_util_create_int_array(n, &list))
00214     {
00215         ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00216         goto CLEANUP;
00217     }
00218     
00219     initialize_flow_data(problem, min_cost, max_cost, s, t, res, &m, dist, pred);
00220 
00221     stop = (int)(2 * pow(n, 2.0 / 3.0) + 0.5);
00222     m = (int)(sqrt(m * 1.0) + 0.5);
00223     if(m < stop) stop = m;
00224 
00225     shortest_augmenting_path(n, s, t, stop, res, dist, pred, &flow);
00226     if(flow < problem->size)
00227         ford_fulkerson_labeling(n, s, t, res, dist, pred, &flow, list);
00228     
00229     if(flow == problem->size)
00230         *result = ARROW_TRUE;
00231     
00232 CLEANUP:
00233     if(dist != NULL) free(dist);
00234     if(pred != NULL) free(pred);
00235     if(res_space != NULL) free(res_space);
00236     if(res != NULL) free(res);
00237     if(list != NULL) free(list);
00238     
00239     return ret;
00240 }

00243 /****************************************************************************
00244  * Private function implementations
00245  ****************************************************************************/
00246 void
00247 initialize_flow_data(arrow_problem *problem, int min_cost, int max_cost, 
00248                      int s, int t, int **res, int *m, int *dist, int *pred)
00249 {
00250     int i, j, cost;
00251     
00252     *m = problem->size * 2;
00253     for(i = 0; i < problem->size; i++)
00254     {
00255         for(j = 0; j < problem->size; j++)
00256         {
00257             cost = problem->get_cost(problem, i, j);
00258             if((i != j) && (cost >= min_cost) && (cost <= max_cost))
00259             {
00260                 res[i][j + problem->size] = 1;
00261                 (*m)++;
00262             }
00263             else
00264             {
00265                 res[i][j + problem->size] = 0;
00266             }
00267 
00268             res[i][j] = 0;
00269             res[i + problem->size][j] = 0;
00270             res[i + problem->size][j + problem->size] = 0;
00271         }
00272         res[s][i] = 1;
00273         res[s][i + problem->size] = 0; //
00274         res[i][s] = 0;
00275         res[i][t] = 0;
00276         res[i + problem->size][s] = 0; //
00277         res[i + problem->size][t] = 1;
00278         res[t][i] = 0; //
00279         res[t][i + problem->size] = 0;    
00280         
00281         dist[i] = 2;
00282         dist[i + problem->size] = 1;
00283         
00284         pred[i] = -1;
00285         pred[i + problem->size] = -1;
00286     }
00287     res[s][s] = 0;
00288     res[s][t] = 0;
00289     res[t][s] = 0;
00290     res[t][t] = 0;
00291     
00292     dist[s] = 3;  dist[t] = 0;
00293     pred[s] = -1; pred[t] = -1;
00294 }
00295 
00296 void
00297 shortest_augmenting_path(int n, int s, int t, int stop, 
00298                          int **res, int *dist, int *pred, int *flow)
00299 {
00300     int i, j, u, v;
00301     int min_d, admissable;
00302     
00303     i = s;
00304     while(dist[s] < stop)
00305     {
00306         min_d = n + 1;        
00307         admissable = ARROW_FALSE;
00308         
00309         //arrow_debug(" - i = %d\n", i);
00310         
00311         for(j = 0; j < n; j++)
00312         {            
00313             if(res[i][j] > 0)
00314             {
00315                 if(dist[i] == dist[j] + 1)
00316                 {
00317                     //arrow_debug(" - found admissable arc (%d,%d)\n", i, j);
00318                     admissable = ARROW_TRUE;
00319                     //arrow_debug(" - pred[%d] = %d\n", j, i);
00320                     pred[j] = i;
00321                     //arrow_debug(" - i = %d\n", j);
00322                     i = j;
00323                     
00324                     if(i == t)
00325                     {
00326                         //arrow_debug(" - i == t, so augment!\n");
00327                         (*flow)++;
00328                         //arrow_debug(" - flow is now %d\n", *flow);
00329                         u = i;
00330                         v = pred[u];
00331                         while(u != s)
00332                         {
00333                             res[u][v] = 1;
00334                             res[v][u] = -1;
00335                             //arrow_debug(" - res[%d][%d] = 1\n", u, v);
00336                             //arrow_debug(" - res[%d][%d] = -1\n", v, u);
00337                             u = v;
00338                             v = pred[u];
00339                         }
00340                         i = s;
00341                     }
00342                     
00343                     break;
00344                 }
00345                 else
00346                 {
00347                     if(dist[j] + 1 < min_d)
00348                         min_d = dist[j] + 1;
00349                 }
00350             }
00351         }
00352         
00353         if(!admissable)
00354         {
00355             //arrow_debug(" - No admissable arcs found; retreat!\n");
00356             dist[i] = min_d;
00357             //arrow_debug(" - dist[%d] = %d\n", i, min_d);
00358             if(i != s)
00359                 i = pred[i];
00360         }
00361         
00362         //arrow_debug("\n");
00363     }
00364 }
00365 
00366 void
00367 ford_fulkerson_labeling(int n, int s, int t, int **res, int *label,
00368                         int *pred, int *flow,  int *list)
00369 {
00370     int i, j, u, v;
00371     int idx = 0;
00372     
00373     label[t] = ARROW_TRUE;
00374     while(label[t])
00375     {
00376         for(i = 0; i < n; i++)
00377         {
00378             label[i] = ARROW_FALSE;
00379             pred[i] = -1;
00380         }
00381         
00382         label[s] = ARROW_TRUE;
00383         list[idx] = s; idx++;
00384         
00385         while(idx > 0)
00386         {
00387             i = list[idx - 1]; idx--;
00388             for(j = 0; j < n; j++)
00389             {
00390                 if(res[i][j] > 0)
00391                 {
00392                     if(!label[j])
00393                     {
00394                         label[j] = ARROW_TRUE;
00395                         pred[j] = i;
00396                         list[idx++] = j;
00397                     }
00398                 }
00399             }
00400         }
00401         
00402         if(label[t])
00403         {
00404             (*flow)++;
00405             u = t;
00406             v = pred[u];
00407             while(u != s)
00408             {
00409                 res[u][v] = 1;
00410                 res[v][u] = -1;
00411                 u = v;
00412                 v = pred[u];
00413             }
00414         }
00415     }
00416 }
